section.name: nest
section.description: Deep parse trees which all implementations must support.

test.name: list_index
test.description: Member = Member '[' Expr ']'. Nested indices are supported up to 12 times.

test.name: message_literal
test.description: Member = Member '{' [FieldInits] '}'. Nested messages supported up to 12 levels deep.
test.expr: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{child: NestedTestAllTypes{payload: TestAllTypes{single_int64: 137}}}}}}}}}}}}.payload.single_int64

test.name: funcall
test.description: Primary = ['.'] IDENT ['(' [ExprList] ')']. Nested function calls supported up to 12 levels deep.

test.name: list_literal
test.description: Primary = '[' [ExprList] ']'. Nested list literals up to 12 levels deep.

test.name: map_literal
test.description: Primary = '{' [MapInits] '}'. Nested map literals up to 12 levels deep.

test.name: parens
test.description: Primary = '(' Expr ')'

section.name: repeat
section.description: Repetitive parse trees which all implementations must support.

test.name: conditional
test.description: Expr = ConditionalOr ['?' ConditionalOr ':' Expr]. Chained ternary operators up to 24 levels.
test.expr: true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : true ? true : false

test.name: or
test.description: ConditionalOr = [ConditionalOr '||'] ConditionalAnd. Logical OR statements with 32 conditions.
test.expr: false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || false || true

test.name: and
test.description: ConditionalAnd = [ConditionalAnd '&&'] Relation. Logical AND statements with 32 conditions.
test.expr: true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && true && false

test.name: add_sub
test.description: Addition = [Addition ('+' | '-')] Multiplication. Addition operators are supported up to 24 times consecutively.

test.name: mul_div
test.description: Multiplication = [Multiplication ('*' | '/' | '%')] Unary. Multiplication operators are supported up to 24 times consecutively.

test.name: not
test.description: Unary = '!' {'!'} Member

test.name: unary_neg
test.description: Unary = '-' {'-'} Member

test.name: select
test.description: Member = Member '.' IDENT ['(' [ExprList] ')']. Selection is supported up to 12 times consecutively.

test.name: index
test.description: Member = Member '[' Expr ']'. Indexing is supported up to 12 times consecutively.

test.name: list_literal
test.description: Primary = '[' [ExprList] ']'. List literals with up to 32 elements.

test.name: map_literal
test.description: Primary = '{' [MapInits] '}'. Map literals with up to 32 entries.

test.name: message_literal
test.description: Member = Member '{' [FieldInits] '}'. Message literals with up to 32 fields.
test.expr: TestAllTypes{single_int32: 5, single_int64: 10, single_uint32: 15u, single_uint64: 20u, single_sint32: 25, single_sint64: 30, single_fixed32: 35u, single_fixed64: 40u, single_float: 45.0, single_double: 50.0, single_bool: true, single_string: 'sixty', single_bytes: b'sixty-five', single_value: 70.0, single_int64_wrapper: 75, single_int32_wrapper: 80, single_double_wrapper: 85.0, single_float_wrapper: 90.0, single_uint64_wrapper: 95u, single_uint32_wrapper: 100u, single_string_wrapper: 'one hundred five', single_bool_wrapper: true, repeated_int32: [115], repeated_int64: [120], repeated_uint32: [125u], repeated_uint64: [130u], repeated_sint32: [135], repeated_sint64: [140], repeated_fixed32: [145u], repeated_fixed64: [150u], repeated_sfixed32: [155], repeated_float: [160.0]}.single_sint64

section.name: string_literals
section.description: Check that string literals are properly parsed

section.name: bytes_literals
section.description: Check that bytes literals are properly parsed

section.name: whitespace
section.description: Check that whitespace is ignored by the grammar.

test.name: spaces
test.description: Check that spaces are ignored.
test.expr: [ . cel. expr .conformance. proto3. TestAllTypes { single_int64 : int ( 17 ) } . single_int64 ] [ 0 ] == ( 18 - 1 ) && ! false ? 1 : 2

test.name: tabs
test.description: Check that tabs (`\t`) are ignored.
test.expr: [	.	cel.	expr	.conformance.	proto3.	TestAllTypes	{	single_int64	:	int	(	17	)	}	.	single_int64	]	[	0	]	==	(	18	-	1	)	&&	!	false	?	1	:	2

test.name: new_lines
test.description: Check that new lines (`\n`) are ignored.
test.expr:
[
.
cel.
expr
.conformance.
proto3.
TestAllTypes
{
single_int64
:
int
(
17
)
}
.
single_int64
]
[
0
]
==
(
18
-
1
)

!
false
?

:

test.name: new_pages
test.description: Check that new pages (`\f`) are ignored.
test.expr: [ . cel. expr .conformance. proto3. TestAllTypes { single_int64 : int ( 17 ) } . single_int64 ] [ 0 ] == ( 18 - 1 ) && ! false ? 1 : 2

test.name: carriage_returns
test.description: Check that carriage returns (`\r`) are ignored.
test.expr: [.cel.expr.conformance.proto3.TestAllTypes{single_int64:int(17)}.single_int64][0]==(18-1)&&!false?1:2

section.name: comments
section.description: Check that comments are ignored by the grammar. Note that carriage returns alone cannot terminate comments.

test.name: new_line_terminated
test.description: Check that new-line-terminated comments are ignored.

section.name: selectors
section.description: Check that reserved identifiers are permitted as selectors as long as they are not language keywords

test.name: as
test.description: Check that `as` can be used as a selector.

test.name: break
test.description: Check that `break` can be used as a selector.

test.name: const
test.description: Check that `const` can be used as a selector.

test.name: continue
test.description: Check that `continue` can be used as a selector.

test.name: else
test.description: Check that `else` can be used as a selector.

test.name: for
test.description: Check that `for` can be used as a selector.

test.name: function
test.description: Check that `function` can be used as a selector.

test.name: if
test.description: Check that `if` can be used as a selector.

test.name: import
test.description: Check that `import` can be used as a selector.

test.name: let
test.description: Check that `let` can be used as a selector.

test.name: loop
test.description: Check that `loop` can be used as a selector.

test.name: package
test.description: Check that `package` can be used as a selector.

test.name: namespace
test.description: Check that `namespace` can be used as a selector.

test.name: return
test.description: Check that `return` can be used as a selector.

test.name: var
test.description: Check that `var` can be used as a selector.

test.name: void
test.description: Check that `void` can be used as a selector.

test.name: while
test.description: Check that `while` can be used as a selector.
